definition: thorough, the particular auditory effect produced by a given cause, measure the depth of (a body of water) with a sounding line
details:
adjective
- thorough
= example: thorough
= synonyms: good
- (of sleep) deep and complete
= synonyms: heavy
- in excellent physical condition
= synonyms: good
- exercising or showing good judgment
= synonyms: healthy, intelligent, levelheaded, level-headed
- free from moral defect
= example: free from moral defect
- financially secure and safe
= example: financially secure and safe
- in good condition
- having legal efficacy or force
= example: having legal efficacy or force
= synonyms: effectual, legal
- logically valid
= example: logically valid
= synonyms: reasoned, well-grounded
noun
- the particular auditory effect produced by a given cause
= example: the particular auditory effect produced by a given cause
- the subjective sensation of hearing something
= example: the subjective sensation of hearing something
- the audible part of a transmitted signal
= synonyms: audio
- (phonetics) an individual sound unit of speech without concern as to whether or not it is a phoneme of some language
= synonyms: phone, speech sound
- the sudden occurrence of an audible event
= example: the sudden occurrence of an audible event
- a large ocean inlet or deep bay
= example: a large ocean inlet or deep bay
- a narrow channel of the sea joining two larger bodies of water
= synonyms: strait
- mechanical vibrations transmitted by an elastic medium
= example: mechanical vibrations transmitted by an elastic medium
verb
- measure the depth of (a body of water) with a sounding line
= synonyms: fathom
- utter with vibrating vocal chords
= synonyms: voice
- appear in a certain way
= example: appear in a certain way
- give off a certain sound or sounds
= example: give off a certain sound or sounds
- make a certain noise or sound
= synonyms: go
- cause to sound
= example: cause to sound
- announce by means of a sound
= example: announce by means of a sound
